detailsOfAchievement: SATABDIRA KALAKARA A PROFILE About three & half decade back a small group of young, enthusiastic cultural activists and some students of Drama Dept. of Utkal Sangeet Mahavidyalay united in a pleasant summer evening with a lot of dreams in their eyes.They had nothing but commitment and dedication for development of theatre. Their determination won over all obstacles and Satabdira Kalakar a cultural institution made its humble debut on April 18, 1976 in the temple city. Since then there was no looking back. The organization was able to cross the boundaries of our State and proved its mettle at far off places like Guwahati, Kolkata, New Delhi (N.S.D), Mumbai, Lucknow, Allahbabad, Visakhapatanam etc. It had created artists, play wrights, directors, and the talent of whose would have remained unnoticed otherwise. By now this organization have been able to stage more than hundred plays besides organizing seminars, workshops on Theatre and Folk Culture, Children Drama Festivals for eleven years and after that National Multilingual Drama Festival for twelve years consecutively. PLAYS STAGED OUTSIDE ORISSA Play Place Yuga Jyoti Allahabad (1979) Aruna Rangara Pakshi NSD,New Delhi (180) Avataar Guwahati (East Zone Theatre Festival (1986), Kolkata (1993, 1998, 2001 & 2004) & Lucknow (1989) Ruddhadwar Guwahati (East Zone Theatre Festival (1991), Kolkata (1993, 2006) & Santiniketan (2006) Jibanyasa New Delhi (1997) & ;Kolkata,Visakh. Biplabi krutibas Mumbai university [spring festival] 2009 PLAYS STAGED INSIDE ORISSA 120 plays. Of different playwrights of different languages. PLAYS RECORDED BY DOOR DARSHAN KENDRA, BHUBANESWAR 18 plays PLAYS RECORDED BY ETV (ORIYA) 4 plays WORK DONE FOR CHILDREN In the late eighties the Organisation decided to hold Childrens Drama Festival from the year 1988-98. [11years] SEMINARS AND WORKSHOPS FOR DEVELOPMENT OF THEATRE With the help of national Sangeet Natak Akademi and Ministry of Human Resources Development, Government of India, the organization has conducted 12 workshops for major as well as for child artists for enriching their artistic talents &34 theatre seminars.. ACTING SCHOOL Satabdira-Kalakar also started an acting school to bring young blood to the main stream. 5 batches of students consisting of 62 students have been trained up in basic theory of acting, (both stage and camera).The students after successfully completing the 4 months course, engaged in field of art NATIONAL MULTINGUAL DRAMA FESTIVAL From the year 1998, the organization is organization National Multilingual Drama Festival, the first of its kind on help from EZCC, Kolkata, NSNA, Delhi and Department of Culture, Government of Orissa with a noble intention to develop besides providing opportunity to the esteemed audience to witness the successful plays of eminent theatre celebrities of the country. FUTURE PLAN Satabdira Kalakar is determined to construct a mini auditorium on the land allotted in its favour by the Government of Orissa for regular theatre, to bring out a theatre journal and to start a Theatre Repertory Company. It will only be a matter of time. detailsOfAchievement: Skill Development Training Ever since its inception in 1995, SEWAK has been conducting skill development trainings to provide alternative means of livelihood to the poor and unemployed youth masses of the district. Now we are in command of an impressive infrastructure for conducting free, residential vocational training programs and till date more than 3432 young boys and girls have received training in trades like carpentry, masonry, bamboo craft, soft-toy making and tailoring, and are able to earn their livelihood with part or full time employment. The drive for Water and Sanitation Between 2000 and 2001, we carried out a rigorous water and sanitation program across the district. Trudging through the dusty village tracks and insistently parleying with the unenthusiastic folks we finally succeeded in generating demands for over 50,000 household toilets. Simultaneously we popularized Sujala Dhara scheme 28 numbers of villages were supplied with drinking water drawn from deep bore-wells.

detailsOfAchievement: Serve & Help Charitable Trust (SHCT) is an indigenous non-denominational, non-profit, non-political, faith ministry and social service organization was founded on 8th May 2013 under the Indian Trust Act of 1882. The Registered Office of the Trust is situated at Nazarpur, Jagatpur, District- Cuttack-754021, Odisha, India. It is interested to building an integrated Trust developed through multifarious spiritual and social service activities like Health and Education, Childcare, Women Empowerment, Plantation, care for old aged, Awareness Programmes, Dispensaries, Skill Development Programme, Relief & Rehabilitation Programme. Now, we particularly focus to improve the lives and outcomes for destitute, orphaned and abandoned children by creating community based family style group homes and emphasize on socioeconomic development in society. Serve & Help Charitable Trust (SHCT) has come a long way since 2011. It was started with the goal of providing a home for destitute, orphaned, helpless and abandoned children and give the all facility as they desire from like a family. They get of a family like environment. Today we are take step for the child holistic development by providing better education, Nutrition, Parenting, and Training. Our Vision is to establish a ADRASH VIDALAYA where plenty of orphan, poor, destitute & help less children (both boys & girls) of the society are keep and make their future in society by provide them better Hygienic, Safe & Secure Environment ,Nutrition Food, study including Computer Education & painting, Yoga & Training, Music & Dance Training and Vocational Training. We also work for the runaway, missing, abandoned, working children from around us, rescue and resettle them in proper way. Our Trust has also involved in plantation programmes, Health camp, Jalchhatra and social awareness programme on different social issues from time to time.

detailsOfAchievement: By the patronization of Central Social Welfare Board New Delhi the organization has set up a Family Counseling Centre at Angul wef: 7th Jan,2004.The main thrust behind the programme is to strengthen the social fabric by preventing families from breaking-up and promoting harmony within the family through counseling by the counselors. It is providing preventive, curative and rehabilitative services to the women who are victims of atrocities. The centre aims at providing distressed women with services like crisis intervention, investigation in dowry death cases, counseling in the cases of marital/family mal-adjustment, reconciliation in cases of separation and out -of-court settlement in the marital cases and referral services like short stay, legal aid and police assistance etc. The organization by the financial support of State Social Welfare Board, Odisha, and Bhubaneswar has been implementing 2 Nos. Creche Centres under the Rajiv Gandhi National Creche Scheme Programme for the children of working mothers since 1st Feb, 2006 at Angarabandha and Santarapur of Angul to promote a healthy all round development of children of working/ailing mothers particularly those employed in the unorganized sector and belonging to the BPL category. The crche offers parental care, nutritional food intakes, motivation for coverage of immunizations, recreational facilities and pre-school education to 60 children within the age group of 0-6 years of the working and ailing mothers of the locality.

detailsOfAchievement: SWAD emerged from the humanitarian and women empowerment activities by some dedicated women in the rural area of Puri district, Orissa in the year 1989. It got its legal entity in the year 1992. Since its inception it has been working in the field of Socio-Economic development of marginalized community, women empowerment, Disaster Preparedness & Management program, Livelihood promotion, Environment protection & Biodiversity conservation and Gender equity. Presently the swad is working in 43 Grampanchayats of two Blocks namely Satyabadi & Gop Block of Puri District. SWAD focused on the [1] Community Capacity Building, [2] Institution Building, [3] Networking and Linkage, [4] Advocacy & Lobby. Followings are some the Achievement of SWAD By the initiation of swad 220 Self Help Groups have been formed and strengthened, 5 cluster level federation of Women Self Help Group formed, 1 Women Self Help Cooperative established in Satyabadi block of Puri District. 107 SHGs were linked up in different Govt. scheme like sgsy, Revolving fund etc. 1960 Women are enhancing their skill and knowledge and getting income of Rs.300 to Rs.3000 per month. 32 women atrocities case solved. 75 Village Disaster Management Committee have formed and enhance their capacity to manage Disaster in their village, because natural disaster like flood, cyclone and water logging is a recurrent phenomenon of this area. 300 volunteer were develop their skills and mobilized to work for their locality. With the support of Concern world wide India, swad constructed 1 Flood Shelter, 5 Seed cum Grain bank, 3 mound to protect the human and livestock from flood. Disaster fund generated in 75 villages and stock pilled in 15 village to manage disaster, because community is the first responder of any disaster. By the active involvement of the community and support from different funding agencies like Oxfam g.b, Concern Worldwide, Toyota Motor Corporation, swad taken up plantation in a massive scale. At least 1.5 lakhs plants has been planted in both household and community level. Unused water logged land became productive. 6 pond renovated & 5 deep bore well installed in order to manage waterlogged land. SWAD has received the PRAKRUTI MITRA award for the year 2008-2009 by the chief minister of Orissa for its greater contribution towards Environment promotional activities in Satyabadi block of Puri district. 100 Village Action Group [VAG] and 1 Block level Action Group is there to lobby and advocacy on the issues and rights.

detailsOfAchievement: We have been running one Child Lagour School in Koksara block since 1999. Also running 9 Continuing Education Centre in Jaipatna Block of Kalahandi District. SEWA is also running a Sewing School in collaboration with the USHA International. Simultaneously a food and nutrition centre is running in collaboration with the District Industry Centre, Kalahandi. SEWA has undertaken skill upgradation and skill transfer programme with D.I.C. Kalahandi and SEWA has also undertaken training of rural women (forest users) on behalf of the D.F.O. (South), Kalahandi. Besides this SEWA has implemented RCH project, Swasthya Mela and Children Health Card movement on behalf of the Chief District Medical Officer, Kalahandi. Recently, we undertook the distribution work of musquoto nets and spraying of DDT in two blocks( i.e. M. Rampur & Narla) involving 13 Gram Panchayats. Further, SEWA has successfully implemented AGP Programme under WCD, Environmental Awareness Campaign under Ministry of Forest & Environment, Sanitation Programme under R.W.S.S., Kalahandi. Apart from these SEWA is also involve in socio cultural activities in the district in terms of organisation of seminars, cultural functions, competitions, exhibitions and workshop on women, child and legal issues etc.

title: soor mandir
detailsOfAchievement: The main objective of Soor Mandir is to preserve,propagate and develop the culture and tradition through the performance of the dance to derive spirituality and harmony and feeling the essence of beauty of God through this classical dance. Soor mandir is functioning last 17 years in the heart of this millennium city for imparting Odissi dance & Orissan Folk dance in the purest and practical sence.Soor mandir has produced 35 dance dramas and 48 Group dance for the stage & Door Darshan .Soor Mandir is the empanelled institution of Eastern Zonal Cultural Centre,Kolkatta,,Indian Council For Cultural Relation, New Delhi. Soor mandir has honoured by the Governor of Orissa-2000, by the Governor of Chennai-2006, by the Home Minister of Karnatak-2007. The dance group of Soor mandir has performed Puri Beach Festival, Kharavela Festival,Rajiv Festival, Ellora Festival, Hampi festival, Taj Festival, Marool Festival, Soorya Festival in abroad an many Festivals of India and abroad also. Soor mandir has performed 2084 stage shows till now. To revive and restore the orissan traditions of RAJA PARBA Soor mandir has organized a festival RAJA MAHOTSABA  since 2006 in the cultural capital of the state,Cuttack.. This magnificent festival has been masterminded to forge forward the typical and traditional Dance,Drama & Music of Oriyas through the performances of hundreds of eminent as well as promising artists of the state. These unique venture symbolizing the FOLK TRADITION is a cultural event, purely voluntary non-profit basis.

Most of the rural population in Mayurbhanj depends on agriculture and non-timber forest produce. The growth of this sector is however stagnant because of the poor and arid soil conditions and lack of irrigation facilities.
